body.p: An entity that has previously applied IAS 40 (2000) and elects for the first time to classify and account for some or all eligible property interests held under operating leases as investment property shall recognise the effect of that election as an adjustment to the opening balance of retained earnings for the period in which the election is first made. In addition:

li.p: if the entity has previously disclosed publicly (in financial statements or otherwise) the fair value of those property interests in earlier periods (measured on a basis that satisfies the definition of fair value in IFRS 13), the entity is encouraged, but not required:
to adjust the opening balance of retained earnings for the earliest period presented for which such fair value was disclosed publicly; and
to restate comparative information for those periods; and
if the entity has not previously disclosed publicly the information described in (a), it shall not restate comparative information and shall disclose that fact.
